summary: Email correspondence between attorneys regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, specifically concerning the identification and subpoena of a trial witness from JPMorgan Chase Bank. The emails discuss scheduling calls and providing a broadly worded subpoena to the bank.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's Office about securing a trial witness from JPMorgan for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, involved in the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution and coordinating with defense counsel on witness matters.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, which is the subject of the legal correspondence.

connections.description: Communicating professionally regarding witness coordination and subpoena matters for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
Stoddart is an attorney involved in the Maxwell case, likely representing a party with an interest (potentially JPMorgan) in the proceedings.
Sahni is a prosecutor for the U.S. Attorney's Office in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Witness Coordination Call Scheduled
events.description: Attorneys Allison Stoddart and Anjan Sahni schedule a call for 3 PM to discuss trial witness topics related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Subpoena Provided to JPMorgan
events.description: Anjan Sahni provides a broadly worded subpoena to JPMorgan Chase Bank to facilitate the identification of a trial witness, as requested by Allison Stoddart.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: JPMorgan Chase Bank was being asked to provide a witness for the trial in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
The U.S. Attorney's Office provided a broadly worded subpoena to JPMorgan to facilitate witness identification.
The correspondence indicates ongoing coordination between defense/prosecution and financial institutions regarding trial evidence.
The emails are dated October 2021, during the pre-trial phase of Maxwell's criminal case.
